statements: SELECT * FROM energy_consumption_data ORDER BY meter_id DESC LIMIT 5
SELECT consumption, timestamp FROM energy_consumption_data WHERE meter_id = 100 ORDER BY timestamp ASC
SELECT AVG(consumption) AS average_consumption FROM energy_consumption_data GROUP BY timestamp
SELECT * FROM energy_consumption_data WHERE consumption > 50
SELECT meter_id, timestamp, consumption FROM energy_consumption_data ORDER BY timestamp DESC
SELECT * FROM energy_consumption_data WHERE meter_id = 1 ORDER BY timestamp DESC
SELECT meter_id, SUM(consumption) AS total_consumption FROM energy_consumption_data GROUP BY meter_id HAVING total_consumption > 100
SELECT MAX(consumption) AS max_consumption, MIN(consumption) AS min_consumption FROM energy_consumption_data
SELECT meter_id, AVG(consumption) AS avg_consumption, COUNT(*) AS num_records FROM energy_consumption_data GROUP BY meter_id ORDER BY meter_id
SELECT * FROM energy_consumption_data WHERE timestamp BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-01-31' ORDER BY consumption DESC
SELECT * FROM smart_meters;
SELECT meter_id, timestamp FROM smart_meters WHERE energy_consumed > 100;
SELECT * FROM energy_reports WHERE report_date >= '2022-01-01' ORDER BY total_energy_consumed DESC;
SELECT meter_id, SUM(total_energy_consumed) AS total_consumed FROM energy_reports GROUP BY meter_id;
SELECT MAX(energy_consumed) AS max_energy_consumed FROM smart_meters;
SELECT * FROM smart_meters ORDER BY timestamp DESC LIMIT 10;
SELECT meter_id, energy_consumed FROM smart_meters WHERE energy_consumed > 1000;
SELECT * FROM smart_meters WHERE energy_consumed BETWEEN 500 AND 1000 ORDER BY timestamp ASC;
SELECT meter_id, SUM(energy_consumed) AS total_energy_consumed FROM smart_meters GROUP BY meter_id;
SELECT meter_id, AVG(energy_consumed) AS avg_energy_consumed FROM smart_meters GROUP BY meter_id HAVING AVG(energy_consumed) > 800;
SELECT * FROM smart_meter_data;
SELECT meter_id, date, energy_consumption FROM smart_meter_data WHERE energy_consumption > 100;
SELECT * FROM meter_locations WHERE city = 'New York';
SELECT meter_id, latitude, longitude FROM meter_locations ORDER BY latitude DESC;
SELECT reading_id, date, time, reading FROM meter_readings WHERE reading < 50 ORDER BY date ASC, time DESC;
SELECT * FROM smart_meter_data ORDER BY date DESC, time DESC, energy_consumption ASC LIMIT 10;
SELECT city, address, latitude, longitude FROM meter_locations WHERE city = 'New York';
SELECT reading_id, date, time, reading FROM meter_readings ORDER BY reading DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT meter_id, SUM(energy_consumption) AS total_energy FROM smart_meter_data GROUP BY meter_id HAVING total_energy > 1000 ORDER BY total_energy DESC;
SELECT m.city, m.address, r.date, r.time, r.reading FROM meter_locations m JOIN meter_readings r ON m.meter_id = r.meter_id WHERE r.reading > 50 ORDER BY r.reading DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT * FROM energy_consumption_data;
SELECT date, energy_usage FROM energy_consumption_data ORDER BY date DESC;
SELECT meter_id, location FROM meter_details WHERE installation_date > '2021-01-01';
SELECT reading_id, reading_date, reading FROM meter_readings WHERE reading > 100 ORDER BY reading_date ASC;
SELECT error_id, error_type, error_description FROM meter_errors;
SELECT * FROM energy_consumption_data ORDER BY date DESC, time ASC LIMIT 5
SELECT meter_id, date, time, energy_usage FROM energy_consumption_data WHERE meter_id = 1
SELECT meter_id, location FROM meter_details WHERE installation_date >= '2022-01-01' AND installation_date <= '2022-06-01'
SELECT reading_id, meter_id, reading_date, reading FROM meter_readings ORDER BY reading_date DESC LIMIT 3
SELECT meter_id, error_type FROM meter_errors WHERE error_type IN ('Power Outage', 'Meter Fault')
SELECT * FROM smart_meters WHERE id = 1;
SELECT meter_id, date, time FROM meter_readings ORDER BY date DESC, time ASC;
SELECT name, address FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 3;
SELECT * FROM meter_locations WHERE latitude > 40.0 AND longitude < -75.0;
SELECT meter_id, analysis_date, peak_time, peak_consumption FROM analyzed_consumption ORDER BY peak_consumption DESC;
SELECT * FROM smart_meters ORDER BY date DESC, time ASC LIMIT 10;
SELECT name, address FROM customers WHERE address LIKE '%Street%' ORDER BY name ASC;
SELECT meter_id, MAX(reading) AS max_reading FROM meter_readings GROUP BY meter_id HAVING max_reading > 100 ORDER BY max_reading DESC;
SELECT meter_id, latitude, longitude FROM meter_locations WHERE latitude < 40 AND longitude > -80;
SELECT meter_id, analysis_date, peak_time, peak_consumption FROM analyzed_consumption WHERE peak_consumption BETWEEN 50 AND 100 ORDER BY analysis_date ASC;
